response_parsed.title: Securing Data Pipelines Using FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide provides a comprehensive walkthrough on how to secure data pipelines using FastAPI, a modern web framework for building APIs in Python 3.12+.
key_points: Setting up the development environment with FastAPI and Uvicorn
Implementing Authentication and Authorization strategies (JWT, OAuth2)
Securing data using encryption techniques and best practices
Data validation and input sanitization for preventing injection attacks
Rate limiting and handling CORS for protecting against DDoS attacks

code_examples.code:
from fastapi import FastAPI, Depends
app = FastAPI()
...

from fastapi.security import OAuth2PasswordBearer
oauth2_scheme = OAuth2PasswordBearer(tokenUrl='token')

version_notes: This tutorial is designed for Python 3.12+ and FastAPI 0.70.0
Please ensure you have the latest version of FastAPI installed using pip install fastapi-plugins or via the fastapi init command
caveats: Always keep your dependencies up to date, as security vulnerabilities can arise in third-party packages
Never hardcode sensitive information like API keys and secret keys directly into your codebase
